content: the panel to join the ribbing as you go along row 2 5sc back loop only ch1 turn row 3 5sc blo 2 slip_stitch turn repeat row 2-3 until you reach the end of the row don t slip_stitch the last 5 single crochets and at the fold the square in half and sew it together with a corner of the panel and just keep going on with needle or with slip stitches the single_crochet on the side of the panel turn the tubular piece inside out when you reach the shoulder again keep the single_crochet going on the front panel too it s a bit trickier to see where to put your single_crochet in the front panel but the hand movement you made in the back should help you when reaching the corner repeat the steps for the ribbing if you want to make it bind off at the end measuring the length of the panels find the middle point half the length and mark it with a stitch marker use four stitch markers to highlight the point in every side of the two panels on the good side place the strap below the midpoint you marked using the yarn you have sew the strap together with the panel with a needle or with slip stitches repeat on every panel and side 4 times total always layering the strap on the good side of the panels optional side straps you can wear the sweater vest even as a loose fit without any binding but if you want it a bit more cinched make some side straps and add them on to keep it together foundation chain take your 5 5mm hook start the chain with a thread long enough for sewing 13ch row single_crochet in each chain 12sc ch1 turn weave in any threads that are hanging loose repeat until it s 8cm high if possible try to have the hook on the same side as the starting i highly recommend blocking this sweater vest to point/thread make more visible the basketweave stitch to make bind off leaving a long thread for sewing sure all measurements for bust and length are correct and for a finished overall look if you recreate this vest please tag or dm @neneedle on instagram or tiktok so i can see like and share if you don t use social media i would still love to see your creation you can email me at neneedle italy@gmail com happy crocheting~ all copyrights @neneedle all copyrights
